did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: National Forum on Life Cycles and Volunteering records, 1996-1998.

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: New York State College of Human Ecology.National Forum on Life Cycles and Volunteering.

did.physdesc: Published materials, correspondence, newspaper articles, surveys, video.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Correspondence, meeting minutes, advertising, alumni surveys, a video "The Impact on Work, Family and Mid-life Issues," information on speakers, and other records of a New York State College of Human Ecology conference held April 30 - May 1, 1998.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, meeting minutes, advertising, a video "The Impact on Work, Family and Mid-life Issues", information on speakers, and other records of a New York State College of Human Ecology conference held April 30 - May 1, 1998.

controlaccess.head: Names:
controlaccess.corpname: New York State College of Human Ecology.
New York State College of Human Ecology--Conferences.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: National Forum on Life Cycles and Volunteering records, #23-25-2977. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

did.unittitle: Contents
Beginnings: The Arrival of Margaret Hendricks, Formulation of a Topic, and Initial Goals and Plans
Steering Committee: The Selection Process, Profiles of Candidates, Offer and Acceptance Letters, and Final List
Steering Committee: Agendas, Minutes and Notes
Correspondence with New York Congressman Amory Houghton and New York Office of National and Community Service Executive Director Nikki Smith
Resources: Academic and Research Materials on Volunteerism Consulted by Hendricks
Budgets, Contracts, and Travel
Expenses and Deposits
Marketing and Advertisement
America's Promise and the President's Summit in Washington, DC
Published Materials on Cornell, the National Forum, and the President's Summit,
Newspaper Articles, Newsletters and Magazines on Volunteerism

Speakers Part 1 - Correspondence and Profiles: Donna S. Anderson, S. Jeffrey Bastable, Syrelle Bernstein, Paula J. Beugen, Bonnie T. Brannon, Jeffrey L. Brudney, Christine G. Franklin, Vicki Clark, Susan J. Ellis, Robert K. Goodwin, and Donald N. Johnson

Speakers Part II - Ronald Kinnamon, Edward J. Kramer, Nancy Latimer, Marjorie Ohaus Lillard, Miriam Lyons-Frolow, Charles P. Mazza, Marsha D. McCormick, Dagmar E. McGill, Phyllis Moen, Jean M. O'Neil, Anne Firor Scott, Kenneth R. Smith, Gretchen E. Stringer, Jean Szabadi, and Mary Wolf,
Speakers Part III - Introducers' Letters, Accommodations, and Honoraria, and Speaker Information
The Videoconference: Plans, Program, Notes and Speakers
Confirmation Letters to Videoconference Sponsors (Red Cross and VA Tech),

Correspondence with Volunteer Organizations and Sponsors: The Association of Junior Leagues International, America's Promise, The Partnership, The Points of Light Foundation, Sisters of America, Cooperative Extension, YMCA, YWCA, PCCW, C&PL, HOBY,
College of Human Ecology Advancement Committee: Correspondence, Agendas and Minutes
Human Ecology Alumni Association (HEAA) Profiles, Correspondence, and Meetings
Alumni Awards for Outstanding Volunteer Work in Conjunction with the National Forum: Alumni Survey and Award Applications; Award Letters; Information and Correspondence with Martha Ohaus
Final Drafts: Schedule, Program, Speakers, and Information Packets; Bibliography
Forum, Program and Session Evaluation Samples; Response Cards and Follow-Up Letters
Alumni Surveys (A-Z)
The Impact on Work, Family and Mid-Life Issues
